message: When I open my eyes, I feel a pillow under my head.
...When did I go back to my room?
I try to remember, but my thoughts feel slow, like my head is full of mud.
...Then I hear a noise.
Is someone by the window?
I turn my head to look.
Mink is sitting on the couch by the window, looking outside.
...I'm still half-asleep. I must be seeing things.
For some reason... <K>it looks like Mink is praying.
It's not like he has his hands together or his eyes closed or anything like that...
It's just... something about the light, maybe... about the way it illuminates his face.
From time to time, he takes a pull from his pipe. His eyes never leave the window.
He doesn't have his usual impenetrable aura... It really does look like he's praying.
But I just can't think of Mink as a pious person.
Even if he did pray... who would he pray to?
Does he believe in God? Does he hold anything sacred?
It's just... too far removed from the Mink I know...
But as I wrestle with the notion, I realize something.

The way Mink chases me down no matter where I run... The way he never lets up, never gives me an out, until he's taken what he wants...

Maybe that's how he treats everything in life.
He pursues his goals relentlessly, to the exclusion of all else.
What could be driving him to do that?
...I feel myself growing tired again. I close my eyes without fighting it.
In the darkness, I hear Mink get up.
His heavy footsteps pass my bed.
...No. He stopped just next to me. The gentle fragrance of cinnamon hangs in the air.
It's become a familiar scent. No wonder. It's probably rubbed off on me by now.
It's a nice smell...
Feeling strangely at ease, I drift off to sleep.
